author: Derek de Koff
title: The downside of being too handsome? Pietro Boselli explains
text:
So pleased to be part of the @benchtm and @benchbodyph family. Great people make a well-loved homegrown brand! Manila, see you soon! A post shared by Pietro Boselli (@pietroboselli) on Feb 7, 2017 at 3:58am PST 

To ask a handsome man to explain the downside of being handsome is to set that person up for failure. 
Related: Did Pietro Boselli accidentally show his wares during this photoshoot? 
Yet physique model/math teacher Pietro Boselli rises to the occasion well, and manages to not completely cheese himself out. Against the current is the way forward A post shared by Pietro Boselli (@pietroboselli) on Sep 9, 2016 at 9:05am PDT 

“I don’t think there would be any direct disadvantage,” he says, “apart from maybe some stereotypes or the fact that people won’t necessarily focus on other aspects of your personality.” Last week in Milan with @dsquared2 ?? #bitchwhere A post shared by Pietro Boselli (@pietroboselli) on Jul 25, 2016 at 10:33am PDT 

As for judging people by their physical appearance first, he says, “We cannot help it.” 
“It’s obvious that if someone to you looks good, you’re more prone to being talkative to them or to approach them. When that happens, you overlook other things.” 

As for how fellow academics have responded to his modeling career, he says: 
“I felt like people in academe would look down on that. Only by growing up and maturing, you will learn how to embrace every aspect of your life and see that it is amazing, that you can do things that are so different. Explore a talent that otherwise wouldn’t be explored in academe at all.”
